intro: Iryanthera macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leafed beautyberry, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant purple to violet berries, which are clustered in groups of three and serve as a food source for various birds and mammals. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive and ornamental appearance. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Iryanthera macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and conservation efforts due to its ecological importance.
